alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 02 at 12:02PM PST until January 03 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...High astronomical tides may cause flooding in some low- lying areas along Humboldt Bay and the northern Humboldt coast. On Monday...strong southwest winds may result in enhanced wave run up at area beaches, especially around 11 AM Monday morning when high tide is forecast to peak at 8.73 feet, plus a half- foot to a foot of tidal anomaly is possible. * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast County. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and local low-lying roads close to Humboldt Bay and the immediate coast, with only isolated road closures expected. Jackson Ranch Road, King Salmon, Centerville Beach, and other low-lying sections of Samoa Peninsula will likely see flooding.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
